meanings.definition: To place on a throne as a ruler or monarch.
meanings.sent1: The king enthrones his son as the new ruler of the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the queen enthrones the prince with a crown.
meanings.sent3: The royal cat playfully enthrones itself on the king's chair.
meanings.sent4: In the fairy tale, the magical sword enthrones the humble peasant as the rightful king.
meanings.sent5: The majestic ceremony enthrones the chosen leader in front of the cheering crowd.

meanings.definition: To invest with sovereign power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The council enthrones the wise elder as the village's new leader.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ritual enthrones the chosen one as the guardian of the sacred land.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel jokingly enthrones itself as the ruler of the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The responsibility of leadership enthrones a person with both power and duty.
meanings.sent5: The magical amulet enthrones the wearer with the ability to command the elements.
